    • Field Detail

      • tileSizeInPixels

        public static final int tileSizeInPixels
        This is the size of one Tile in pixels for visualisation. It doesn't represent the pixels on the screen, which depend on the Zoom Level.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • isWalkable

        public boolean isWalkable(boolean considerCharacters)
        Most Tiles are walkable. Others (e.g. Trees, Hedges, Walls etc.) aren't. Whether they are walkable depends on the TileType (undone: and on whether something on the Tile is blocking it).
        Parameters:
        considerCharacters - If true Tiles with a Character considered non-walkable.

      • canShootThrough

        public boolean canShootThrough()
        All walkable tiles can be shot through, most non-walkable Tiles can't be shot through (like Trees, Walls) but some can (like Water).

      • getCharacter

        public Character getCharacter()

      • getNeighbours

        public Tile[] getNeighbours(boolean includeDiagonals)
        Returns all the Neighbours of this main.game.engine.Tile in an Array. Some Neighbours might be null! (At the end of the map).
        Parameters:
        includeDiagonals - Whether the 4 diagonal Tiles should be included.
        Returns:
        The Array with all the neighbouring Tiles. Depending on includeDiagonals the Array contains 4 or 8 Tiles. Some Neighbours might be null!

      • getAllTilesInRange

        public java.util.HashMap<Tile,java.lang.Integer> getAllTilesInRange(int range,
                                                                    boolean withWalking)
        Returns all the Tiles in the specified range from this Tile.
        Parameters:
        range - The range in Tiles.
        withWalking - True if the Tiles should be reachable by walking.
        Returns:
        An Array of all the Tiles in range. Is null if this Tile isn't walkable! If not null then should never be empty.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The Tile's coordinates as "(x/y)".
